courses.description: This course presents the latest developments and advancements in biochemistry and molecular biology. It aims to alert students the trends and recent breakthroughs in biochemical and biomedical research. Contents will vary from year to year.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to understand recent developments in research fields related to Biochemistry and Molecular Biology. Basic and novel concepts of various topics and their future developments will be introduced and elaborated by teachers. Students are expected to read the recommended readings provided for each lecture topic, and to search for additional information in the library and online to study on their own. Towards the end of the course, students are required to present an idea of their interest in a poster format.

繁體
透過本課程，學生將了解有關生物化學與分子生物學研究領域的最新發展。各種主題的基本概念和它們的未來發展將得到介紹和闡述。在每個演講的主題學生都可從閱讀推薦讀物、以及在圖書館或網上尋找更多的信息。在接近課程的尾聲，學生必須利用海報格式去展述一個自選題目。

简体
透过本课程，学生将了解有关生物化学与分子生物学研究领域的最新发展。各种主题的基本概念和它们的未来发展将得到介绍和阐述。在每个演讲的主题学生都可从阅读推荐读物、以及在图书馆或网上寻找更多的信息。在接近课程的尾声，学生必须利用海报格式去展述一个自选题目。
courses.course_syllabus:
Lecture topics are determined by individual teaching staffs of the course. They vary every year to reflect the latest development in the field of biochemical research. The lecture topics can be briefly classified into three major areas: New Research Areas (e.g. synthetic biology), Cellular Biochemistry (e.g. stem cells), and Biochemistry of Diseases (e.g. cancer, Alzheimer).

繁體
課程講座的題目是由個別教學人員所決定 。每年有所不同，以反映生化研究領域的最新發展 。講座主題可以簡要地分為三個主要領域：新的研究領域（如合成生物學），細胞生物化學（例如幹細胞），以及生物化學和疾病（如癌症，老年癡呆症等）。

简体
课程讲座的题目是由个别教学人员所决定 。每年有所不同，以反映生化研究领域的最新发展 。讲座主题可以简要地分为三个主要领域：新的研究领域（如合成生物学），细胞生物化学（例如干细胞），以及生物化学和疾病（如癌症，老年痴呆症等）。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Students are encouraged to express their views on overall course arrangement and individual lecture content directly to the teacher concerned and to the course coordinator. Students are also encouraged to discuss anything related to the course in the forum at the accompanied Blackboard site for the course. Finally, students can express their opinions on the questionnaire during the course evaluation period.

繁體
學生可直接向有關教師和學科主任表達他們個人對整體課程安排或講課內容的意見。我們也鼓勵學生在Blackboard站點論壇討論任何與課程有關的問題。最後，學生也可以在評估期在問卷表達他們對課程的意見。

简体
学生可直接向有关教师和学科主任表达他们个人对整体课程安排或讲课内容的意见。我们也鼓励学生在Blackboard站点论坛讨论任何与课程有关的问题。最后，学生也可以在评估期在问卷表达他们对课程的意见。
courses.required_readings: Lecture handout for each of the topics will be uploaded to the accompanied Blackboard site a week before the lecture. Required readings for each topic will be provided by the teaching staff concerned. The reading materials are expected to change every year to reflect the latest development in the research field.
courses.recommended_readings:
Additional reading materials will be provided by individual teachers.

Students are also encouraged to use the online PubMed search engine (http://pubmed.gov) to find related reference materials for self-study.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Fundamentals of Biochemistry

meetings.instructor:
Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon, 
Professor LAU Kwok Fai

courses.description: The course introduces the fundamental principles of biochemistry that are essential for all life science disciplines. It covers the importance of water, structure-function relationships of biomolecules (including amino acids, proteins, carbohydrates, lipids and nucleic acids), the biochemical logic of the metabolic pathways, and an overview of metabolism with emphasis on how biomolecules interconvert into each other.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To appreciate the importance of water in living organism.

2. To understand the structure-function relationships of different types of biomolecules.

3. To understand the chemical logic (thermodynamics, mechanism, and catalysis) behind biochemical reactions.

4. To have an overview of metabolic pathways, and appreciate how biomolecules are interconverting with each other.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Water – the medium of life

- Molecular structure of water

- Weak interactions in aqueous system

- Acid/base equilibrium and buffers

2. Biomolecules

- Carbohydrates

- Lipids

- Nucleotide and nucleic acids

- Proteins

3. Thermodynamics

- Free energy as a measure of a reaction's tendency to proceed spontaneously

- Concepts of 'high-energy' compounds and coupled reactions

- Low of energy and cycling of carbon/nitrogen in the biosphere

- Energy relationship between catabolic and anabolic pathway

- Oxidation of carbon fuels as a major source of cellular energy

- NAD(P)H/FADH2 as universal electron carriers

- ATP is synthesized by proton gradients across membrane generated by transferring electrons to oxygen

- The light reaction of photosynthesis generates both proton gradients and reducing equivalents

- The dark reaction of photosynthesis uses the reducing power generated for biosynthesis of sugar from CO2

4. Enzyme catalysis

- Enzymes affect reaction rates but not equilibria

- Enzymes increase reaction rates by lowering the activation free energy

- Concepts of transition-state complementarity

- Why biochemical reaction is stereospecific?

- Basic enzyme kinetics

- Enzymes are good target for drug design

5. Chemical logic of biochemical reactions

- Electronegativity and polarity of covalent bond

- Six different types of biochemical reactions

- Reactions in the glycolytic pathway are used as examples to illustrate the recurring motifs in metabolic pathway

- Vitamins as co-factors in enzyme catalysis

6. Overviews of metabolism

- Convergent catabolism

- Divergent anabolism

- Cyclic pathway

- Regulatory strategy

Course evaluation

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Research Internship

meetings.instructor: Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos

courses.description: This course is designed to allow students to gain practical experience in scientific research in a laboratory or biotechnology firm during the summer period or term time. All research or internship projects, locally or overseas, must be approved by the School.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, students should be able to:
1. experience to carry out an independent research under supervision by a faculty staff;
2. design simple experiments and follow protocols to carry out some biochemical analyses;
3. obtain data and carry out data analysis with simple statistics, and
4. learn how to write a brief scientific report.

Objectives for students development:1. Learn how to integrate basic biochemistry techniques to perform some experiments or develop an assay.
2. Learn how to collect and read literature in a specific area of research.
3. Learn how to design simple experiments, carry out the experimental procedure independently, and work as a member of the team.
4. Learn how to compile or collect data with accuracy and precision.
5. Learn how to analyze the data obtained and write a short paper to summarize the experiments or work done.
6. Better prepare students to learn time management skills and do independent research for their final year project (Supervised Research)
courses.course_syllabus:
There is no specific content for this course which is guided by a supervisor and the project is to be assigned by the supervisor. Summer Interns (including DREAM) may take this course but a local supervisor or supervisor from Biochemistry Program has to be assigned in addition to the internship supervisor for marking. Title of the project report must be different from other courses.

Duration (study period):
Students taking this course usually start their experiments in the summer or early at term start and complete the project with a report written for marking by the end of first term. Deadline of submission of report is at term end. Two markers (including the supervisor and an extra marker is needed for dual supervisors) will evaluate the report (assessment form attached).

Job nature:Students may hold a project on testing and purification of a biomolecule, cloning of a gene, detection of a gene mutation, performing PCR assay or ELISA assay, purification of a recombinant protein, developing an assay from modified protocols, doing literature search of patents and help filing a patent application in a patent law firm, doing data mining (In Silico analyses) or sequence analyses, testing of a drug, etc.

Report for evaluation:
1. The report should include a cover page with the title of the research, followed with a one page abstract (< 250 words), an introduction, materials and methods, results and discussion, acknowledgement, and references.
2. Rationale of the study and background information should be covered in the introduction with some literature review and justification of why you are working on this project (importance of the project). Carefully explain the procedure of the experiments and technical details of how the assay is carried out in the section of materials and methods. After presenting the results and discuss the meaning of the results, explain briefly what could be done next or what could have been done better to obtain better results.
3. Explain the limitations of the present study. At the end, a conclusion has to be made in the discussion part to end the report.
4. Usually, 3-5 figures and tables should be enough for such a short report of around 30 pages with word count < 6,000. Students may consider follow the journal format of Biochemical and Biophysical Research Communications.

Who should take this course:
All Biochemistry majors are welcome to take this course which is an elective course (group C). For those who have participated the DREAM program, any research projects in local government departments or biotech company and those who joined a law firm for internship with literature (patent) research are also welcome to join this course as well.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students are supposed to meet and contact the supervisor regularly to discuss the project and arrangements. Course teaching evaluation will be conducted to collect comments on the course arrangement and information to improve this course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by supervisor.
courses.recommended_readings:
Web
This website explain how to write a scientific report:
http://geog.arizona.edu/~comrie/geog230/report.htm

courses.description: This course aims at introducing quantitative analyses of biochemical reactions and subcellular components to students. Methods for purification and studies of biomolecules will also be introduced. Techniques including chromatography, gel electrophoresis, centrifugation, fluorescent spectrophotometry and microscopy will be covered. The use of radioisotopes and non-radioactive labelling methods will also be included.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: After completing the course, students should be able to understand both the basic principles and the practical aspects of different methods of biochemical analyses, including chromatography, electrophoresis, centrifugation, radioisotopes and fluorescence techniques. The knowledge gained will be useful in their final year project “Supervised Research in Biochemistry”.
courses.course_syllabus:
Fluorescence Technology: This block is intended to introduce to students an in-depth knowledge of the principles of fluorescence and its applications for biochemistry and cell biology research. Topics include principles of fluorescence, design and application of fluorescence probes, fluorescence measurements, special techniques and recent advances in fluorescence technology.

Chromatography: This session will introduce various chromatography techniques used in biochemistry, for example, partition chromatography, adsorption chromatography, ion exchange chromatography, gel filtration and affinity chromatography. Their use in the purification of proteins will be illustrated.

Electrophoresis: This session will introduce the basic theory of electrophoresis. Particular emphasis will be given to the two basic methods used in the study of proteins, namely sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis and isoelectric focusing. The use of electrophoresis in the study of nucleic acid will be discussed. In addition, the application of the instrumental technique capillary electrophoresis will also be covered.

Centrifugation: This session will introduce the basic theory of centrifugation and the mathematical expression of sedimentation rate. We will also discuss different types of centrifuge and rotor commonly used in biochemical studies. The principles of differential centrifugation and density gradient centrifugation, and their applications in biochemical research will be covered.

X-ray Crystallography: X-ray crystallography is a common method for determination of the three-dimensional structure of proteins. Its basic principles and procedure will be introduced.

Radioisotopes: This session will introduce the nature of radioactivity and types of radioactive decay. Detection methods based on gas ionization, excitation of solid/solution and exposure of photographic emulsions will be discussed. Radiation and biohazard safety of handling radioisotopes will be covered. Applications of radioisotopes in studying metabolic pathways, protein-ligand interactions and DNA/RNA labeling will be discussed.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Proteins and Enzymes

meetings.instructor: Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping

courses.description: Three-dimensional conformations of proteins and protein folding will be discussed with emphasis on structure-function relationships. Basic concepts of proteomic techniques and the investigations of protein structures will be covered. Enzyme catalysis will be introduced with respect to coenzyme requirements, kinetics, catalytic mechanism and regulation of enzymatic activities.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.
courses.course_syllabus:
Protein Structure, Folding and Stability: This session will discuss the basic principles governing the structure of protein. As protein molecules are organized in a structural hierarchy, topology diagrams will be used to illustrate the motifs of protein structure. In particular, the alpha-domain structures, beta structures and the alpha/beta structures will be discussed. The key concepts of thermodynamics and kinetics in the process of protein folding and the stabilization of protein structure will be illustrated.

Structure-Function Relationship in Selected Proteins: Specific examples will be used to illustrate the general structure of membrane proteins. Chaperone are proteins that help correct protein folding while ubiquitin, together with the proteasome system, is responsible for protein degradation. They will be discussed with respect to their structure-function relationship. Transcription factors are DNA-binding proteins that regulate gene activity. Different DNA binding motifs will be introduced. Proteins can be engineered to improve their properties. Methods like DNA shuffling will be discussed.

Protein-Protein Interaction: The different methods for studying protein-protein interaction will be introduced. Among the methods are qualitative ones like co-immunoprecipitation, chemical cross linking, yeast two hybrid system, fluorescent resonance energy transfer, as well as quantitative ones like surface plasmon resonance and isothermal titration calorimetry. The use of mass spectrometry in the identification of protein will be discussed.

Introduction to Enzymes: The basic characteristics of enzymes as biocatalysts, for example the specificity, ability to be regulated and the catalytic power will be introduced. Ribonucleic acids having catalytic activities will be mentioned. The enzyme nomenclature system and the requirement of coenzymes and metals ions for various enzymatic reactions will also be discussed.

Enzyme Kinetics: Different methods for measuring enzyme activities and the precautions needed when performing enzyme assays will be discussed. Michaelis-Menten enzyme steady state kinetics will be covered, with particular emphasis on the significance of the Km and kcat values. Different types of enzyme inhibitors, including allosteric ones, will be introduced. The various means by which enzyme activities can be regulated will be mentioned. Examples will be given to illustrate how the different amino acid residues in the active site of the enzyme contribute to the activity of the enzyme.

Clinical and Industrial Enzymology: This session will introduce the use of enzymes in different clinical applications, for example, the plasma enzyme activity assay as a diagnostic tool, the use of enzyme as a reagent to measure the concentration of certain metabolites, the use of enzyme inhibitor as drugs and the use of enzyme itself as a therapeutic agent. Examples will also be given to illustrate the application of enzymes in industries, particularly, in pharmaceutical and food industries.

繁體
蛋白質的結構，摺合和穩定性：目的是向學生介紹蛋白質結構的一些基本原則，亦會利用拓撲圖來說明蛋白質的結構基序。內容亦包括蛋白質摺合和蛋白質結構穩定的熱力學和動力學的關鍵概念。

特選蛋白質的結構與功能關係：具體的例子包括不同的膜蛋白，協助蛋白質摺合的分子伴侶蛋白，負責蛋白質降解的泛素與蛋白酶體系統，透過與DNA結合來調節基因活動的轉錄因子蛋白。課程亦會介紹蛋白工程，例如透過DNA重組來提高蛋白質的性能。

蛋白質 - 蛋白質相互作用：課程內會討論的方法包括定性的方法，如免疫共沉澱，化學交聯，酵母雙雜交系統，熒光共振能量轉移 ; 以及定量的方法如表面等離子體共振和等溫滴定量熱法等。內容亦包括質譜在蛋白質鑑定的應用。

酶的介紹：目的是向學生介紹酶作為生物催化劑的基本特徵，例如特異性，被調控的能力和催化的能力。內容亦會探討具催化活力的核糖核酸，協助各種酶反應的輔酶和金屬離子，酶的命名系統等。

酶動力學：目的是向學生介紹測量酶活性的不同方法和當中必須注意的事項。內容亦包括不同類型的酶抑製劑及調節酶活性的不同機制。此外，亦會透過實際例子來說明酶活性部位的氨基酸如何推動酶的活性。

臨床及工業酶學：此部份將介紹酶在不同臨床領域上的應用，例如，檢測血液中酶的活性來作臨床診斷，利用酶作為試劑來檢定某些代謝物的濃度，使用酶的活性抑製劑作為藥物，甚或使用酶本身作為一種治療劑。此外，亦會介紹酶在工業上，特別是在製藥和食品工業上的應用。

简体
蛋白质的结构，折合和稳定性：目的是向学生介绍蛋白质结构的一些基本原则，亦会利用拓扑图来说明蛋白质的结构基序。内容亦包括蛋白质折合和蛋白质结构稳定的热力学和动力学的关键概念。

特选蛋白质的结构与功能关系：具体的例子包括不同的膜蛋白，协助蛋白质折合的分子伴侣蛋白，负责蛋白质降解的泛素与蛋白酶体系统，透过与DNA结合来调节基因活动的转录因子蛋白。课程亦会介绍蛋白工程，例如透过DNA重组来提高蛋白质的性能。

蛋白质 - 蛋白质相互作用：课程内会讨论的方法包括定性的方法，如免疫共沉淀，化学交联，酵母双杂交系统，荧光共振能量转移 ; 以及定量的方法如表面等离子体共振和等温滴定量热法等。内容亦包括质谱在蛋白质鉴定的应用。

酶的介绍：目的是向学生介绍酶作为生物催化剂的基本特征，例如特异性，被调控的能力和催化的能力。内容亦会探讨具催化活力的核糖核酸，协助各种酶反应的辅酶和金属离子，酶的命名系统等。

酶动力学：目的是向学生介绍测量酶活性的不同方法和当中必须注意的事项。内容亦包括不同类型的酶抑制剂及调节酶活性的不同机制。此外，亦会透过实际例子来说明酶活性部位的氨基酸如何推动酶的活性。

临床及工业酶学：此部份将介绍酶在不同临床领域上的应用，例如，检测血液中酶的活性来作临床诊断，利用酶作为试剂来检定某些代谢物的浓度，使用酶的活性抑制剂作为药物，甚或使用酶本身作为一种治疗剂。此外，亦会介绍酶在工业上，特别是在制药和食品工业上的应用。
courses.recommended_readings:
References:

1. Fundamentals of Enzymology: the Cell and Molecular Biology of Catalytic Proteins. N. C. Price and L. Stevens, 3rd edition. Oxford University Press, 1999.

2. Proteins: Structure and Function. D. Whitford, John Wiley & Sons Ltd., 2005.

3. Biochemistry. J.M. Berg, J.L. Tymoczko and L. Stryer, New York: W.H. Freeman, 2012.

4. Introduction to Protein Structure. C. Branden and J. Tooze, 2nd edition. New York: Garland Pub., 1999.

courses.description: This course discusses basic areas of molecular biology, including characteristics of DNA and RNA, genomic elements, DNA replication, transcription, translation, mutation, repair, gene regulation and epigenetics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4010 or BIOL2310.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To understand the basic phenomena of life in the molecular biology level, which include the characteristics of DNA and RNA, genome and elements, DNA replication, DNA mutation and repair, transcription, translation, gene regulation and epigenetics.

2. To know the major differences of the above phenomena between prokaryotic and eukaryotic organisms.

1. 從分子生物學角度了解生命現象，包括：DNA和RNA的性質，真核基因組和元件的特質，基因的複製、轉錄、轉譯、變異、修複、調控和表徵遺傳。

2. 明白上述現象在真核細胞和原核細胞的分別。

1. 从分子生物学角度了解生命现象，包括：DNA和RNA的性质，真核基因组和元件的特质，基因的复制、转录、转译、变异、修复、调控和表征遗传。

2. 明白上述现象在真核细胞和原核细胞的分别。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Characteristics of DNA and RNA, 2. Eukaryotic genome and elements, 3. DNA replication, 4. DNA mutation, 5. DNA repair, 6. Transcription of DNA, 7. RNA processing, 8. Transcriptional regulation, 9. Protein translation, 10. Translational control, 11. epigenetics.

1. DNA和RNA的性質，2. 基因組和元件，3. DNA複製，4. DNA轉錄，5. RNA修飾，6. 轉錄調控，7. DNA變異，8. DNA修補， 9. 蛋白質轉譯及調控，10. 表徵遺傳。

1. DNA和RNA的性质，2. 基因组和组件，3. DNA复制，4. DNA转录，5. RNA修饰，6. 转录调控，7. DNA变异，8. DNA修补， 9. 蛋白质转译及调控，10. 表征遗传。
courses.feedback_evaluation: Feedback through email, forum on Blackboard and term end course evaluation.
courses.recommended_readings:
J.M. Berg, J.L. Tymoczko, L. Stryer (2012) Biochemistry. 7th Edition.

courses.description: This course covers the basic concepts of recombinant DNA techniques, including restriction and modification enzymes and their applications in recombinant DNA techniques, analyses of nucleic acids, insertion of DNA fragment into prokaryotic and eukaryotic vectors and transformation of model organisms and expression of recombinant proteins.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4020.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To know the enzymes and techniques for DNA manipulation, detection, amplification, sequencing, transformation, protein expression and the study of gene expression and analysis of genomes.
2. To be able to integrate the knowledge obtained for dealing with actual examples.

1. 知悉各種酶和技術以用作DNA操控、探測、擴增、測序、轉化、蛋白質和基因表達和基因組分析。
2. 能夠將有關知識整合以解決實際的例子。

1. 知悉各种酶和技术以用作DNA操控、探测、扩增、测序、转化、蛋白质和基因表达和基因组分析。
2. 能够将有关知识整合以解决实际的例子。

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Bioenergetics and Metabolism

meetings.instructor: Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui

courses.description: This course covers basic concepts of how biological organisms obtain energy and perform metabolism to build different biomolecules. The following biochemical processes underlying energy transformation in living organisms will be discussed: photosynthesis, glycolysis, citric acid cycle, electron transport, oxidative phosphorylation, fatty acid oxidation. Biosynthesis of carbohydrates, lipids, nucleic acids, and proteins will be provided. The integration of metabolic pathways will also be discussed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Module 1: After completion of this module, students should be able to understand metabolic pathways such as the production of energy and the utilization of energy in biosynthesis of metabolic fuels – carbohydrates, lipids and proteins.

Module 2: Upon completion of this module, students should be able to understand metabolic pathways for the synthesis and degradation of nucleotides. They will also appreciate the importance of these pathways for cellular events and therapeutic development.
courses.course_syllabus:
Overview of Bioenergetics and Metabolism
Overview of Bioenergetics and Metabolism

Glycolysis and the Catabolism of Hexoses1. Glycolysis: a central pathway of glucose metabolism
2. Utilization of other sugars as metabolic fuels
3. Pentose phosphate pathway: production of reducing powder and formation of pentose sugars

The Citric Acid Cycle1. Common pathway for oxidation of acetyl group
2. Regulation and amphibolic nature of TCA cycle

Oxidative Phosphorylation and Photophosphorylation
1. Structure and function of electron transport chain
2. Mechanism of ATP synthesis
3. Structure of photosynthesis apparatus, light harvesting centre and reaction centre
4. The generation of ATP and Calvin cycle

Qxidation of Fatty Acids
1. Utilization of fatty acid as metabolic fuels
2. Degradative pathway for fatty acid of even or odd number of carbons
3. Formation and utilization of ketone bodies

Oxidation of Amino Acids and the Urea Cycle
1. Pathways of amino acid degradation
2. Metabolic fates of amino groups
3. Nitrogen excretion and the urea cycle

Carbohydrate Biosynthesis
1. Gluconeogenesis
2. Biosynthesis of glycogen, other carbohydrates and complex carbohydrates

Lipid Biosynthesis1. Biosynthesis of fatty acids and triacylglycerol
2. Biosynthesis of membrane phospholipids
3. Biosynthesis of cholesterol, steroids and isoprenoids

Biosynthesis of Amino Acids
1. Biosynthesis of amino acids
2. Molecules derived from amino acids

Integration of Metabolism
Integration of Metabolism

Biosynthesis of Nucleotide Metabolism
Biosynthesis of degradation of nucleotides

2. Biochemistry by Lubert Stryer.
3. Principles of Biochemistry by Donald J. Voet, Judith G.. Voet & Charlotte W. Pratt.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Self-study Modules in Biochemistry
courses.description: Students will study special biochemical topics on their own, under the supervision of a faculty member. Each student is required to make oral presentations and submit short written reports. In so doing, students will also develop general self-learning skills.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE3092. Pre-requisite: BCHE2000.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Life-long learning skill is an essential component of university training, expected outcomes of this course include:

1. search of relevant material for selected biochemistry topics

2. ability of critical reading of the material and documents

3. ability to make clear and effective presentation and discussion in oral and written formats

4. develop a sense of team spirit of collaborative work and problem solving skills

5. use of computer skills for the search of information

繁體
掌握終身學習技能是大學訓練的重要成分，學生在本科將會發展以下能力：
1. 就有關生物化學專題作文獻資料搜尋的技巧

2. 具批判性思維閱讀及分析文獻的內容

3. 清楚的口頭匯報及書寫報告的能力

4. 解決問題的能力及團體精神

5. 應用電腦及網上資料庫搜尋文獻的技巧

简体
掌握终身学习技能是大学训练的重要成分，学生在本科将会发展以下能力：
1. 就有关生物化学专题作文献资料搜寻的技巧

2. 具批判性思维阅读及分析文献的内容

3. 清楚的口头汇报及书写报告的能力

4. 解决问题的能力及团体精神

5. 应用电脑及网上资料库搜寻文献的技巧
courses.course_syllabus:
This course includes lectures on information search and scientific paper reading and writing. Oral presentations and discussion will be arranged in small groups. A set of review papers on various biochemistry topics will be selected by teachers for students to obtain wide scope of biochemistry knowledge. Students are then requested to select a research article related to biochemistry. Students are requested to give oral presentations on the review paper and selected articles. In the term end, a written report should be submitted in term end.

本科在學期開始以授課介紹科學文獻資料庫搜尋及閱讀書寫的技巧。以後包括小組討論及口頭匯報。內容包括由教授提供的生物化學專題評論及一篇學生自選生物化學研究文章。學生須於學期結束前遞交一份書寫報告。

courses.description: This course aims to enhance studentsâ€™ abilities and competence in information search, critical reading and analysis, and communication in biochemistry. In addition, transferable skills and strategies for professional development necessary for career entry and for a sustainable satisfying career are also our emphases. Through different course activities, students should also be able to develop their generic skills in collaborative teamwork, problem solving, and peer-assessment.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE3090. Pre-requisite: BCHE2000.
courses.learning_outcomes:

2. Learn to apply and integrate different approaches to address biochemical questions
3. Learn to read scientific papers critically
4. Learn to make clear and effective presentation and discussion in oral and written formats
5. Develop skills in generating innovative ideas for scientific research
6. Develop a sense of team spirit of collaborative work and problem solving skills

courses.course_syllabus:
This course includes lectures on reading and presentation of a scientific paper. Sessions for oral presentations and discussion will be arranged in small groups. A set of scientific papers on various biochemistry topics will be assigned to students to obtain wide scope of biochemistry knowledge. Students are requested to give one group oral presentation on an assigned paper and submit an individual written report on the relevant research topic in the term end. In addition, this course will include a workshop series on career entry and trajectory development. Case studies and examples on combining developing transferable skills in global commercialization and career development will be discussed. This course content will also be supplemented with e-learning resources ([www.bch.cuhk.edu.hk/learnbiochem](http://www.bch.cuhk.edu.hk/learnbiochem)).

本科包括一些關於科學論文閲讀和寫作的講座。口頭彙報和討論將以小組的形式進行。教授會派給學生一系列有關生物化學課題的科學論文，使學生獲得廣泛的生物化學知識。學生需要做兩個口頭彙報，內容為一篇由教授指派的文章及一篇學生自選研究文章。學生需在學期結束前遞交一份書寫報告。此外，本科將包括一個有關預備和專業發展職業一系列的研討會，以討論可轉讓技能在全球商業化和職業發展中結合開發的案例研究和範例。

本科包括一些关于科学论文阅读和写作的讲座。口头汇报和讨论将以小组的形式进行。教授会派给学生一系列有关生物化学课题的科学论文，使学生获得广泛的生物化学知识。学生需要做两个口头汇报，内容为一篇由教授指派的文章及一篇学生自选研究文章。学生需在学期结束前递交一份书写报告。此外，本科将包括一个有关预备和专业发展职业一系列的研讨会，以讨论可转让技能在全球商业化和职业发展中结合开发的案例研究和范例。

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Chemical Biology
courses.description: The discipline of chemical biology is focused on the application of chemical principles, particularly organic chemistry, to the study and manipulation of biological systems. Two major focus areas include the development of chemical tools to proteins and cells, and in the identification and creation of novel compounds as therapeutics for the treatment of human disease. The course will begin with a brief review of organic chemistry fundamentals and bio-orthogonal ligand reactions. It will then cover case studies to illustrate the power of chemical biology to solve important problems at the chemistry-biology interface.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 and one of the following three courses: CHEM1070 or 1072 or 1280.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge

* Recall the fundamental aspects of chirality and basic reaction mechanisms in organic chemistry.
* Know the core bio-orthogonal reactions that can be used with biological systems.
* Be aware of the important biological and biomedical problems being tackled by scientists.
* Account for how chemical biology methods are used within biomedical research and pre-clinical drug discovery.

Skill

* Students will be able to assess, evaluate and choose appropriate chemical biology methods to use in their future research studies.

Value

* Chemical biology approaches have led to advances that have led to creation of multiple active biotech companies. The knowledge gained will equip them with the skills needed to pursue careers in disciplines at the chemistry and biology interface.

知識

•回顧有機化學中空間螺旋特性的基本知識和化學反應機理。

•瞭解可應用於生物系統的核心生物正交反應。

•關注科學家正在研究的重要生物學和生物醫學課題。

•說明化學生物學方法如何可以應用在生物醫學的研究和臨床前藥物的新發現。

技能

•學生將能夠測試，評估和選擇適當的化學生物學方法以用於未來的研究。

價值

•化學生物學的研究催生了多家活躍的生物科技公司的創建。學生獲得的相關知識將使他們具備在化學和生物學跨學科領域工作所需的專業技能。

知识

•回顾有机化学中空间螺旋特性的基本知识和化学反应机理。

•了解可应用于生物系统的核心生物正交反应。

•关注科学家正在研究的重要生物学和生物医学课题。

•说明化学生物学方法如何可以应用在生物医学的研究和临床前药物的新发现。

技能

•学生将能够测试，评估和选择适当的化学生物学方法以用于未来的研究。

价值

•化学生物学的研究催生了多家活跃的生物科技公司的创建。学生获得的相关知识将使他们具备在化学和生物学跨学科领域工作所需的专业技能。
courses.course_syllabus:
| Week | Topic |
| --- | --- |
| 週 | 主题 |
| 1 | The properties of atoms and how they form bonds 1. Periodic properties (atomic and ionic radii, electron affinity, ionization energy, electronegativity) 2. Lewis theory, Atomic orbitals, hybrid orbitals and 3. Molecular Geometry |
| 1 | 原子性質及化學鍵生成 1. 週期性（原子和離子半徑，電子親和力，電離能，負電性） 2. 路易斯理論，原子軌道，混成軌道 3. 分子幾何 |
| 2 | Organic chemistry principles relevant to biological reactions I 1. Stereochemistry 2. Nucleophiles and electrophiles 3. Nucleophilic substitution reactions (SN1 and SN2) 4. Chemical synthesis based on nucleophilic substitution reactions |
| 2 | 與生物反應相關的有機化學原理一 1. 立體化學 2. 親核試劑和 親電試劑 3. 親核取代反應 (SN1 and SN2) 4. 基於親核取代反應的化學合成 |
| 3 | Organic chemistry principles relevant to biological reactions II 1. Functional groups in proteins and nucleic acids 2. Nucleophilic substitution reactions in biology 3. Carboxylic acids and their derivatives 4. Chemical reactions on carboxyl groups |
| 3 | 與生物反應相關的有機化學原理二 1. 蛋白質和核酸中的官能團 2. 生物學中的親核取代反應 3. 羧酸及其衍生物 4. 羰基化學反應 |
| 4 | Chemical synthesis of peptides 1. Mechanism and thermodynamics of peptide bond formation 2. Protecting groups 3. Solid phase peptide synthesis 4. Native chemical ligation and their derivatives |
| 4 | 肽的化學合成 1. 肽鍵形成的機理和熱力學 2. 保護基團 3. 固相肽合成 4. 本身已具有的官能團的化學連接及其衍生物 |
| 5 | Natural and bioconjugate protein reactions 1. Bioorthogonal reactions for protein labeling and conjugation 2. Expressed protein ligation 3. Isopeptide formation in biology: SpyTag/SpyCatcher reaction, ubiquitination, etc. |
| 5 | 天然蛋白及生物接合蛋白的化學反應 1. 用於蛋白質標記和接合的生物正交反應 2. 基因表達蛋白的連接反應 3. 生物學中的異肽形成：SpyTag / SpyCatcher反應，泛素化等。 |
| 6 | Chemistry of enzymes and coenzymes 1. Enzymes and catalysis 2. Chemistry of selected coenzymes 3. Michaelis-Menton Kinetics 4. Catalytic antibodies |
| 6 | 酶和輔酶的化學 1. 酶與催化 2. 代表性輔酶的化學 3. Michaelis-Menton動力學 4. 催化性抗體 |
| 7 | Chemical Biology of Carbohydrates 1. Monosaccharides: structure and reactivity 2. Oligosaccharides and polysaccharides 3. Enzymatic reactions of carbohydrates Midterm Examination (Weeks 1-6) |
| 7 | 碳水化合物的化學生物學 1. 單醣：結構和反應性 2. 寡糖和多醣 3. 碳水化合物的酶促反應 期中考試（1-6週） |
| 8 | From genes to proteins 1. DNA Replication and RNA Transcription 2. Structure of DNA 3. Structure of RNA 4. Synthesis of proteins by protein translation |
| 8 | 蛋白質的生物合成 1. DNA複製和RNA轉錄 2. DNA的結構 3. RNA的結構 4. 蛋白質轉譯和合成 |
| 9 | Directed Evolution 1. Directed Evolution of Nucleic Acids and Enzymes 2. Nucleic acid selection (SELEX) 3. Protein evolution to screen for novel properties (Phage-display, Yeast display, E. coli display, mRNA display) |
| 9 | 定向進化 1. 核酸和酶的定向進化 2. 核酸選擇（SELEX） 3. 蛋白質進化及新特性篩選（噬菌體展示，酵母展示，大腸桿菌展示，mRNA展示） |
| 10 | Incorporating unnatural amino acids into proteins 1. Evolution of tRNA synthetases for incorporation of UAAs 2. Use of the pyrrolysine tRNA/tRNA synthetase for UAA incorporation 3. Application of UAA incorporation for biological and biotechnological studies |
| 10 | 蛋白質中非天然氨基酸的納入 1. tRNA合成酶的進化和UAA納入 2. 吡咯賴氨酸tRNA / tRNA合成酶在UAA納入中的使用 3. UAA納入在生物和生物技術研究的應用 |
| 11 | Special Topics (Novel Roles of Metals in Biology) 1. Zinc and magnesium ions in hydrolytic reactions (metalloproteases, polymerases) 2. Heme and non-heme iron proteins 3. Nickel ions in organometallic reactions 4. Molybdenum and tungsten containing enzymes 5. cis-Pt(NH3)2Cl2 as an anticancer therapeutic |
| 11 | 專題研究 (金屬在生物學中的新作用) 1. 水解反應中的鋅和鎂離子（金屬蛋白酶，聚合酶） 2. 血紅素和非血紅素鐵蛋白 3. 有機金屬反應中的鎳離子 4. 含鉬和鎢的酶 5. cis-Pt(NH3)2Cl2作為抗癌藥 |
| 12 | Special Topics (Protein therapeutics and protein delivery) 1. Antibodies 2. CRISPR (Gene editing) 3. Transcription Factors (Cellular Reprogramming) 4. Strategies for overcoming the barriers to cellular delivery |
| 12 | 專題研究 (蛋白質治療和蛋白質遞送） 1. 抗體 2. CRISPR（基因編輯） 3. 轉錄因子（細胞重新編程） 4. 克服細胞遞送障礙的策略 |
| 13 | Review and Final Examination (Weeks 7-12) |
| 13 | 評論和期末考試 （7-12週） |

| 周 | 主题 |
| --- | --- |

| 1 | 原子性质及化学键生成 1. 周期性（原子和离子半径，电子亲和力，电离能，负电性） 2. 刘易斯理论，原子轨道，混成轨道 3. 分子几何 |
| --- | --- |

| 2 | 与生物反应相关的有机化学原理一 1. 立体化学 2. 亲核试剂和 亲电试剂 3. 亲核取代反应 (SN1 and SN2) 4. 基于亲核取代反应的化学合成 |
| --- | --- |

| 3 | 与生物反应相关的有机化学原理二 1. 蛋白质和核酸中的官能团 2. 生物学中的亲核取代反应 3. 羧酸及其衍生物 4. 羰基化学反应 |

courses.description: This laboratory course is the first part of the consecutive experimental training aims at providing hands-on experience in the basic techniques in biochemical research. A set of experiments to illustrate various molecular biology and recombinant DNA techniques will be performed. These include recombinant DNA construction and characterization, DNA sequencing and analyses, DNA authentication, gene expression study. Students are preferred to attend BCHE3050 and BCHE3070.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4610.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Students should be able to perform simple experiments using molecular biology and recombinant DNA techniques such as DNA preparation, construction and analyses of recombinant DNA, generation of cDNA, DNA sequencing and polymerase chain reaction.
2. Students should be able to grasp the basic concept of molecular biology and recombinant DNA techniques.
3. Knowledge gained from this course is useful for the final year course Supervised Research in Biochemistry and other research work.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Analytical Biochemistry Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui

courses.description: This laboratory course is the second part of the consecutive experimental training aims at providing hands-on experience in the basic techniques in biochemical research. This laboratory course is a continuation of the BCHE3650 course providing basic training in biochemical techniques. Students will learn the application of different biochemical methods in the qualitative and quantitative analyses of biologically active molecules.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE3630. Co-requisite: BCHE3030.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to learn different methods for biochemical analyses, including chromatography, electrophoresis, protein crystallization, centrifugation and fluorescence techniques. Knowledge gained from this course is useful for the final year course “Supervised Research in Biochemistry” and other research work.

學生將學習不同的生化分析方法，包括層析，電泳，蛋白質結晶，離心和熒光技術。所獲知識將有助進行各項的生物化學實驗研究課題。

学生将学习不同的生化分析方法，包括层析，电泳，蛋白质结晶，离心和荧光技术。所获知识将有助进行各项的生物化学实验研究课题。
courses.course_syllabus:
Fluorescence Techniques: Because of its outstanding sensitivity, reliability, non-invasiveness and friendliness to our environment, detection of target molecules by using fluorescence has been a common technology for various types of biochemical and biomedical studies. This session attempts to introduce to students different fluorescence techniques including the use of fluorometer, fluorescence plate reader, confocal microscope, and flow cytometer for a number of biochemical analyses.

Ion Exchange Chromatography: Chromatography is a technique which depends on the distribution of a molecule between two different phases, a stationary phase and a mobile phase. Depending on the stationary phase used, there are different kinds of chromatography which allow for separation of molecules with different properties. In the experiment, ion exchange chromatography will be used to separate three different proteins.

Sodium Dodecyl Sulfate-Polyacrylamide Discontinuous Gel Electrophoresis: SDS is an anionic detergent which binds strongly to protein at a constant ratio such that all the SDS-treated proteins are negatively charged. Besides having the same charge to mass ratio, the SDS-treated proteins also have the same shape. Consequently, when electrophoresed in the molecular sieving polyacrylamide gel, they will be separated according to size and their molecular weight can be determined with reference to the standards.

Separation of Sub-cellular Components by Differential Centrifugation: Differential centrifugation will be used to separate sub-cellular components for biochemical analysis. Different sub-cellular components, such as the nucleus and the cell membrane, have different sedimentation properties and therefore, they can be differentially sedimented to the bottom of the centrifuge tube. In this experiment, we will attempt to separate key cellular components (the nucleus, the mitochondria/membrane and the cytosol fractions) using a simple centrifuge. The experiment was designed to show that by varying the parameters of centrifugation, one could selectively separate cellular components into fractions with distinctive biochemical characteristics.

Crystallization of Lysozyme: The X-ray crystallography is a very important technique to study the three-dimensional structure of proteins. A good X-ray diffraction pattern, however, requires a large protein crystal that is free of contaminants and aggregation. In this experiment, students will acquire the basic skills of producing a crystal of lysozyme. In addition, the effects of different protein and salt concentrations on lysozyme crystallization will also be investigated.

熒光技術：由於其出色的靈敏度，可靠性和非侵入性，通過使用熒光檢測目標分子一直是各類生物化學和生物醫學研究通用的技術。實驗會介紹不同的熒光技術，包括使用的熒光機，熒光微孔板檢測儀，激光共聚焦顯微鏡，流式細胞儀等等。

離子交換層析：層析是一種依賴分子在固定相和流動相之間分佈的技術。利用不同的固定相，可以將具有不同性質的分子分離。在實驗中，學生將會利用離子交換層析法分離三種不同的蛋白質。

十二烷基硫酸鈉 - 聚丙烯酰胺凝膠電泳：十二烷基硫酸鈉能與蛋白質透過一個恆定的比率結合，使得所有經處理的蛋白都帶相應的負電荷。因此，在分子篩聚丙烯酰胺凝膠電泳時，蛋白將根據大小有不同的電泳速度。透過與標準蛋白的比較，可以計算出蛋白的分子量。

差速離心分離：實驗將利用差速離心分離亞細胞的不同部分。不同的細胞部分，如細胞核和細胞膜，具有不同的沉降性，因此，它們可以透過差異沉降到離心管的底部。這個實驗的目的是要顯示通過改變離心分離的參數，我們可以選擇性地分離出各種具鮮明生化特性的細胞部分。

溶菌酶的結晶：X-射線晶體學是研究蛋白質三維結構一個非常重要的技術。然而一個理想的X-射線衍射圖案，需要一個大的蛋白質晶體。在實驗中，學生將學會生產溶菌酶的晶體。此外，亦會探討不同的蛋白濃度和鹽濃度對結晶的影響。

荧光技术：由于其出色的灵敏度，可靠性和非侵入性，通过使用荧光检测目标分子一直是各类生物化学和生物医学研究通用的技术。实验会介绍不同的荧光技术，包括使用的荧光机，荧光微孔板检测仪，激光共聚焦显微镜，流式细胞仪等等。

离子交换层析：层析是一种依赖分子在固定相和流动相之间分布的技术。利用不同的固定相，可以将具有不同性质的分子分离。在实验中，学生将会利用离子交换层析法分离三种不同的蛋白质。

十二烷基硫酸钠 - 聚丙烯酰胺凝胶电泳：十二烷基硫酸钠能与蛋白质透过一个恒定的比率结合，使得所有经处理的蛋白都带相应的负电荷。因此，在分子筛聚丙烯酰胺凝胶电泳时，蛋白将根据大小有不同的电泳速度。透过与标准蛋白的比较，可以计算出蛋白的分子量。

差速离心分离：实验将利用差速离心分离亚细胞的不同部分。不同的细胞部分，如细胞核和细胞膜，具有不同的沉降性，因此，它们可以透过差异沉降到离心管的底部。这个实验的目的是要显示通过改变离心分离的参数，我们可以选择性地分离出各种具鲜明生化特性的细胞部分。

溶菌酶的结晶：X-射线晶体学是研究蛋白质三维结构一个非常重要的技术。然而一个理想的X-射线衍射图案，需要一个大的蛋白质晶体。在实验中，学生将学会生产溶菌酶的晶体能。此外，亦会探讨不同的蛋白浓度和盐浓度对结晶的影响。

courses.description: This course will discuss the structure and components of nervous tissue in relation to its functions. Aspects of metabolism special to the nerve and brain will be examined. These include energy metabolism, water and electrolyte balance, exchanges between blood and brain, and between brain and cerebrospinal fluid, neurotransmitters and modulators, nutrition and development of the nervous system, neuroendocrinology and the biochemistry of mental diseases.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After reading this course, students are expected be able to:

After reading this course, students are expected be able to:

- Outline the special features of the nervous system and its components.

- Describe the functions of the nervous system both at the cellular and molecular levels.

- Explain how neurons communicate with each other in cellular and molecular terms.

- Explain the pathophysiology of certain neurological and neuropsychiatric disorders, and the biochemical basis of treating them.
courses.course_syllabus:
1

1. Structure and function of the central nervous system.

2. Cells of the nervous system

3. Myelin:

a. Structure and function

b. Biosynthesis and genes regulating its biosynthesis

c. Diseases related to myelin dysfunction, eg, multiple sclerosis

4. Biochemistry, physiology and pharmacology of transport system:

a. Blood-brain-CSF barriers

b. Cellular (Membrane) transport

c. Axoplasmic transport

5. Ion channels, potentials and signal conduction

6. Brief introduction of neurochemical techniques:

a. Preparation of brain slice

b. Preparation of synaptosomes

c. Chemical and surgical lesion

d. Tissue culture

e. Molecular biology

7. Metabolism:

a. Brief review of brain metabolism

b. Some inherited neurological diseases related to

metabolic disorders

c. Nutrition and brain function

8. Biochemistry, physiology and pharmacology of synaptic transmission:

a. Classification of neurotransmitters

b. Biosynthesis of transmitters and their regulation

c. Termination of neurotransmission

d. Properties and molecular biology of receptors

e. 2nd messengers and signal transduction

f. Modulation of signal transmission

9. Biochemistry and molecular biology of neurological and psychiatric disorders:

a. Myasthenia gravis

b. Parkinson’s disease

c. Alzheimer's disease

d. Huntington’s disease

e. Affective disorders and schizophrenia

courses.description: This course aims at providing students with the essential concepts of basic and applied immunology. Topics to be covered include architecture and development of the immune system, antigens and antibodies, immunoglobulin genes and diversity, the major histocompatibility system and T cell receptors, tolerance and autoimmunity, and integration of immune responses. The effector mechanisms of the immune system will be introduced, with special emphasis on the role of innate and acquired immunity in health and disease. The relationship of immunology to clinical problems of infectious disease, immunodeficiency, hypersensitivity, transplantation and cancer will be discussed. The applications of immunology to modern medicine and biotechnology, including vaccination, monoclonal antibody production and antibody engineering will also be covered. Students are advised to take BCHE2030 or equivalent before taking this course.

courses.description: This course is to prepare our students with the necessary knowledge and skills for career development and to meet the future demands in the biomedical industries. Core knowledge such as basic concepts and skills of laboratory management, safety and quality assurance in biochemical laboratories will be introduced. Special topics in biochemical testing, manufacturing process, good laboratory practice, laboratory accreditation, and validation of experimental protocols and methods will also be discussed. Part of the class will be taught with MSc students under different course code and assessment scheme.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BBMS6300. Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, students should be able to:

1. understand the concepts of laboratory management;
2. acquire adequate skills of laboratory management;
3. understand quality assurance and execute safety requirements in biochemical laboratories;
4. understand the requirements of good laboratory practice, laboratory accreditation, and validation of experimental protocols and methods.

By the end of the course, students will be able to appreciate and apply the knowledge and skills for biochemical laboratory management and understand the requirements of good laboratory practice, laboratory accreditation and method validation.

courses.description: This course aims at introducing various biochemical principles and techniques for forensic analysis to the students. Students will learn how to observe, collect, analyze and evaluate evidence found at crime scenes. The first part addresses the identification of biological fluids such as blood, semen, and saliva from crime scene. The emphasis will be on the biochemical technologies used in the presumptive and confirmatory tests. The second part covers DNA analysis using RFLP and PCR-STR typing methods, interpretation of DNA typing results, and court presentation of such biological evidence. Mitochondrial DNA typing and Y chromosome DNA typing will also be discussed. It is anticipated that students will apply the biochemistry knowledge they have acquired in junior years in the course. In addition to the core academic knowledge, various in-class activities will also be integrated for students to appreciate the importance and to apply the knowledge they have learnt in class. Teaching takes place in the evening. Part of the class will be taught with MSc students under different course code and assessment scheme.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After finishing this course, students will be able to:

- Develop an understanding of the concept and theory of forensic analysis.

- Understand the analytical techniques involved.

- Discuss the application of forensic science to crime detection.

- Develop practical skills in problem solving, teamwork, and life-long learning.

繁體
完成本課程後，學生將能夠：
- 拓展對科學鑑證的理論分析和概念理解

- 了解科學鑑證的分析技術

- 應用科學鑑證幫助偵查罪案

- 制定解決問題的實際技能，樹立團隊精神和學會終身學習的技巧

简体
完成本课程后，学生将能够：
- 拓展对科学鉴证的理论分析和概念理解

- 了解科学鉴证的分析技术

- 应用科学鉴证帮助侦查罪案

- 制定解决问题的实际技能，树立团队精神和学会终身学习的技巧

courses.description: This course aims at introducing various biochemical aspects of sports and physical activities of human beings to the students. The course will cover fundamental sports physiology and basic anatomy; major proportion of the lectures will be dedicated to designated topics related to the biochemical aspects of sports and physical activities, such as energy utilization, neuro-muscular control, nutrition and fat cell biochemistry, fatigue and recovery, traumas and therapeutics, principles of doping, etc. Lectures will be supplemented with discussions and presentations.
courses.learning_outcomes:
- Master the fundamental sports physiology and anatomy;
- Comprehend the basic knowledge of the selected topics of sports biochemistry;
- Recognize, analyze, and comment on the relationship between biochemistry and sports science;
- Develop practical skills in goal-setting, problem-solving, team-work, and communication skills through different types of learning activities;
- Gain learning methodologies that promote life-long learning in biochemistry and other related disciplines.

繁體
- 掌握基本的運動生理學和解剖學；
- 理解與運動生物化學相關的各科知識理論；
- 明白，分析及評論生物化學和運動科學在理論上和應用上的關係；
- 透過各類型的學習活動，培訓制定目標、解决難題，團隊合作和溝通技巧等重要的個人能力素質；
- 領略終身學習之重要性及發展其相關方法。

簡體
- 掌握基本的运动生理学和解剖学；
- 理解与运动生物化学相关的各科知识理论；
- 明白，分析及评论生物化学和运动科学在理论上和应用上的关系；
- 透过各类型的学习活动，培训制定目标、解决难题，团队合作和沟通技巧等重要的个人能力素质；
- 领略终身学习之重要性及发展其相关方法。
courses.course_syllabus:
- Introduction to muscle and skeleton physiology and anatomy;
- Introduction to basic neuro-muscular control for motion and proprioceptor;
- Biochemistry of bone, soft tissues, and muscle;
- Energy generation and utilization;
- Biology and biochemistry of fat cells;
- Introduction to the cardiovascular system and blood;
- Biochemistry of heart beat and blood pressure control;
- Biochemical principles of physical training;
- Endocrine effect of sports on sports activities;
- Biochemical principles of doping;
- Ischemia, inflammation, spasm, and micro-traumas in sports conditions;
- Biochemical principles of sports traumas and therapeutics;
- Biochemical basis of fatigue and recovery;
- Biochemical basis of the exercises prescribed for disease populations.

繁體
基本肌肉及骨骼生理學和解剖學；
運動神經肌肉控制和本體感受器；
骨骼，軟組織和肌肉的生物化學；
能量釋放及利用；
脂肪細胞生物學及生物化學；
血液和心血管系統；
心跳和血壓的生物化學；
生物化學與體能訓練；
運動與內分泌系統；
藥檢的生化原理；
運動時出現的缺血，炎症，痙攣，微創傷等狀況的生物化學；
運動創傷和治療的生化原理；
疲勞與復元的生化原理；
為病患者設計的運動的生化基礎。

簡體
基本肌肉及骨骼生理学和解剖学；
运动神经肌肉控制和本体感受器；
骨骼，软组织和肌肉的生物化学；
能量释放及利用；

血液和心血管系统；
心跳和血压的生物化学；
生物化学与体能训练；

courses.description: This course describes the chemical structures and biological functions of hormones in vertebrates with special emphasis on human subjects. The evolution of hormonal regulation in vertebrates, as compared with neural control, will be discussed. The organization and operation of different hypothalamus-pituitary-peripheral endocrine gland axes will be discussed. Emphasis will be placed on the molecular aspects of endocrine action. Current advances in molecular endocrinology techniques will be introduced. Students are advised to take BCHE2030 or equivalent before taking this course.

1. Mechanisms of Hormone Action
2. Signaling, Neuro-endocrine System and Methodologies
3. Hypothalamic and Pituitary Hormones
4. Steroidogenesis
5. Actions of Adrenal Steroid Hormones
6. Pancreatic Hormone
7. Diabete Mellitus
8. Hormonal Control of Sex Differentiation and Reproduction
9. Male & Female Reproductive Physiology: Pregnancy, Parturition and Lactation
10. Growth hormone, Prolactin, and their Receptors
11. Hypothalamic-Pituitary-IGF Axis
12. Sympathoadrenal Systems and Catecholamines
13. Hypothalamic-Pituitary-Thyroid Axis
14. Thyroid Actions, Goiter and Graves Disease
15. Calcium Homeostasis and Mineralization
16. Bone Metabolism and Therapies for Disease of Calcium Homeostasis
17. Bone Metabolism: Vitamin D and Therapies for diseases of calcium homeostasis
18. Gastrointestinal Hormones: Evolution and Pathophysiology
19. Posterior Pituitary Hormones and Blood Pressure Control
20. Melatonin and the Pineal Gland: Myths and Facts

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Aspects of Neuroscience Laboratory
courses.description: This course consists of a set of experiments to illustrate various biochemical techniques for the study of neurochemistry. Students are advised to take the lecture course BCHE4040 simultaneously.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Comprehend the basic knowledge and laboratory skills in neuronal cell biology and neurological diagnosis;
2. Recognize how various aspects of neuroscience are important that benefit our daily life;
3. Recognize, analyze, and comment on the scientific and ethical issues of certain topics of neuroscience;
4. Develop practical skills in problem-solving and communication through different types of learning activities;
5. Gain learning methodologies that promote life-long learning in neuroscience and other life science-related discipline.

繁體
1. 學習神經細胞生物學以及診斷中樞神經系統疾病的生物化學原理和實驗；
2. 了解神經科學對日常生活的重要性；
3. 了解，分析和評論一些關於神經科學的學術和道德的議題；
4. 學習解決難題以及溝通的技巧；
5. 培養終身學習的習慣。

简体
1. 学习神经细胞生物学以及诊断中枢神经系统疾病的生物化学原理和实验；
2. 了解神经科学对日常生活的重要性；
3. 了解，分析和评论一些关于神经科学的学术和道德的议题；
4. 学习解决难题以及沟通的技巧；
5. 培养终身学习的习惯。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Knowledge-oriented sessions-
It contains briefing/tutorial sessions, in which the core knowledge of relevant scientific knowledge of neuroscience will be presented;

2. Research-orientated sessions-
It contains a series of research practical sessions, in which students will receive training in the basic techniques in neuronal cell research.

3. Application-oriented sessions-
It contains a series of advanced practical sessions, in which students will be introduced with some techniques for the biochemical analysis of suspected neurological disorders.

4. Student-centred learning-
Students will form groups to investigate a specific topic related to various aspects of neuroscience; at the end of the course, the students will present orally their findings.

繁體
1. 知識為本學習
本部分將透過小組討論等形式教授神經科學中與課程相關的基礎知識；

2. 神經科學基礎實驗
本部分將訓練學生有關神經細胞的基礎實驗技巧；

3. 神經科學基礎實驗
本部分將讓學生學習診斷中樞神經系統疾病的生物化學原理和實驗；

4. 學生為本學習
本部分學生將分組作專題探討並於學期終就研究成果作口頭報告。

简体
1. 知识为本学习
本部分将透过小组讨论等形式教授神经科学中与课程相关的基础知识；

2. 神经科学基础实验
本部分将训练学生有关神经细胞的基础实验技巧；

3. 神经科学基础实验
本部分将让学生学习诊断中枢神经系统疾病的生物化学原理和实验；

4. 学生为本学习
本部分学生将分组作专题探讨并于学期终就研究成果作口头报告。

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Immunology and Haematology Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr. LO Fai Hang

courses.description: This laboratory course serves to provide students with basic training in immunological and haematological techniques at both the molecular and cellular levels. Various aspects and practical applications of the methodology in immunochemistry, cellular immunology and molecular immunology will be illustrated. Students are advised to take the lecture course BCHE4060 simultaneously. This course is similar to the BCHE4660 Basic and Applied Immunology Laboratory offered in 2014 or before.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4660.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, students should be able to:
- Understand the role and features of our immune and blood system;
- Understand the principles of the innate and acquired immunity;
- Appreciate the complexes of control and regulation of immune response;
- Understand the relationship of immunology and haematology to clinical problems;
- Appreciate the applications of immunology and haematology to modern medicine and biotechnology;
- Develop skills in the critical evaluation of immunology and haematology research and theories;
- Acquired competence and generic skills such as written and oral communication of immunology, haematology and critical thinking and analysis in the preparation of laboratory reports.

完成本課程後，學生應該能夠：
- 了解免疫系統和血液系統的特點；
- 理解免疫系統的綜合性；
- 了解抗體的多樣性，免疫反應，自我寬容和免疫系統疾病的分子基礎；
- 欣賞免疫系統和血液系統在生物技術及日常生活的應用；
- 發展在免疫學和血液學研究和理論的批判技能；
- 獲得書面和口頭的溝通技巧，具備分析免疫學和血液學化驗報告批判思維的能力。

完成本课程后，学生应该能够：
- 了解免疫系统和血液系统的特点；
- 理解免疫系统的综合性；
- 了解抗体的多样性，免疫反应，自我宽容和免疫系统疾病的分子基础；
- 欣赏免疫系统和血液系统在生物技术及日常生活的应用；
- 发展在免疫学和血液学研究和理论的批判技能；
- 获得书面和口头的沟通技巧，具备分析免疫学和血液学化验报告批判思维的能力。
courses.course_syllabus:
- Understand the principle, control and regulation of immune and haematological system.
- Understand the relationship of immunology and haematology to clinical problems thought lab tutorial.
- Presentation on immunological and haematological techniques.

- 了解免疫系統和血液系統的特點、控制及調節；
- 透過導修課理解免疫系統和血液系統疾病；
- 進行免疫和血液技術簡佈。

- 了解免疫系统和血液系统的特点、控制及调节；
- 透过导修课理解免疫系统和血液系统疾病；
- 進行免疫和血液技术简布。

courses.title: Medical Biochemistry Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang

courses.description: This course aims at introducing the principles and applications of medical biochemistry. In addition to theories, diagnostic tests for various biochemical parameters in different specimens; as well as the typical techniques of diagnostic microbiology will also be covered.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, students should be able to understand the relationship of clinical biochemistry to clinical problems and to appreciate the applications of clinical biochemistry to modern medicine;

Students will acquire basic techniques related to diagnostic microbiology;

Students will acquire competence and generic skills such as the critical thinking and analytical in medical biochemistry.

完成課程後，學生將能理解醫學生物化學和臨床問題之間的關係；他們更能從而體會到醫學生物化學在現代醫學中的應用。

學生能學習與診斷微生物學有關的基本技術；

學生亦將發展在醫學生物化學中的批判性思維和分析能力。

完成课程后，学生将能理解医学生物化学和临床问题之间的关系；他们更能从而体会到医学生物化学在现代医学中的应用。

学生能学习与诊断微生物学有关的基本技术；

学生亦将发展在医学生物化学中的批判性思维和分析能力。

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Senior Experimental Project I
courses.description: In this course, students carry out an independent laboratory research project either provided by the supervisor or jointly decided with the student. To fulfill the course requirement, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors regularly and submit a research proposal.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4910. Pre-requisite: BCHE3090 or BCHE3092.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students taken this course are expected to develop the following abilities:
1. Integrate the knowledge and skills learnt previously in other courses
2. Survey scientific literature relevant to their research project
3. Read scientific literature critically to identify the scientific questions or problems
4. Design independent research project to address the scientific questions
5. Acquire hands-on research techniques in conducting experiments
6. Develop problem-solving abilities
7. Improve skills in writing scientific proposal
8. Develop a sense of responsibility and term spirit

繁體
學生將會發展以下能力：
1, 應用在課堂中獲得的知識及技能
2. 搜尋文獻的技巧
3. 具批判性思維閱讀及分析文獻的內容，並認知及思考當中的科學問題
4. 就自己的專題研究題目，設計實驗去解說科學問題
5. 各式實驗的操作能力
6. 解決問題的能力
7. 書寫研究計劃報告的能力
8. 有責任感及團體精神

简体
学生将会发展以下能力：
1, 应用在课堂中获得的知识及技能
2. 搜寻文献的技巧
3. 具批判性思维阅读及分析文献的内容，并认知及思考当中的科学问题
4. 就自己的专题研究题目，设计实验去解说科学问题
5. 各式实验的操作能力
6. 解决问题的能力
7. 书写研究计划报告的能力
8. 有责任感及团体精神
courses.course_syllabus:
The students should take the initiative to discuss with their supervisors and compromise a topic for the independent research project. The students should first survey the background of their research project and identify the scientific questions they want to address. The students then design and perform the experiments for this project under the guidance of the supervisors and submit a research proposal in the term end.

繁體
學生要於學期開始前主動聯絡教授，並訂出研究課題。學生就該研究課題搜尋相關文獻，並確定研究方向。學生要設計實驗，進行研究，並於學期結束前遞交一份研究計劃。

简体
学生要于学期开始前主动联络教授，并订出研究课题。学生就该研究课题搜寻相关文献，并确定研究方向。学生要设计实验，进行研究，并于学期结束前递交一份研究计划。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Direct feedback from students to teachers
2. Staff-student consultative committee

1. 學生跟導師直接反映
2. 師生諮詢委員會

简体
1. 学生跟导师直接反映
2. 师生谘询委员会

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Group Research in Biochemistry
courses.description: This course is a capstone course consists of group projects to investigate the heated topics related to Biochemistry, such that students will be inspired by how Biochemistry has made its impact on the globalized knowledge-based society of Hong Kong.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4902 or LSCI4000. Pre-requisite: BCHE3090 or BCHE3092.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Recognize how biochemistry makes various impacts on the society of Hong Kong;
2. Develop practical research skills of information search from various types of databases;
3. Recognize, analyze, and comment on the scientific and ethical issues of certain applications of Biochemistry in Hong Kong;
4. Develop practical skills in team building, problem-solving and communication through different types of learning activities;
5. Gain learning methodologies that promote life-long learning in Biochemistry to promote its impact on the society.

1. 了解生物化學的應用對香港帶來的影響；

2. 學習從不同資料庫獲取各項資訊的方法；

3. 了解，分析和評論一些關於生物化學在社會應用的學術和道德議題；

4. 學習團隊合作，解決難題以及溝通的技巧；

5. 培養終身學習及回饋社會的情操。

1. 了解生物化学的应用对香港带来的影响；

2. 学习从不同资料库获取各项资讯的方法；

3. 了解，分析和评论一些关于生物化学在社会应用的学术和道德议题；

4. 学习团队合作，解决难题以及沟通的技巧；

5. 培养终身学习及回馈社会的情操。
courses.course_syllabus:
Students should form groups with three to four students at the beginning of Term 1. Students in one group should identify a project area and confirm their project title and content by the end of the ADD/DROP period with a written proposal. The project will last for 6-8 weeks, where the students in a group are required to investigate a specific topic with team work and team building elements. This project should not be just a purely academic research study but a project related to various impact of biochemistry on the society of Hong Kong with or without some wet laboratory components. At the end of the course, the students will present their findings and conclusions in an open poster presentation and submit a written report.

Potential projects should include components as follows,

1. Knowledge-oriented sessions-

Students should attend workshop or tutorials, in which the core knowledge of relevant scientific knowledge of biochemistry, including scientific paper reading and writing and basic calculation and statistics in Biochemistry, etc. are given.

2. Technical skill-orientated sessions-

Students should arrange their practical training, including information technology and data search, computer software for data analysis, etc. for their projects.

3. Experience and exposure sessions-

Students should participate in various learning activities such as 1) surveys, 2) site visits, 3) field studies, etc. and learn to appreciate the applications of Biochemistry for social enterprises.

4. Team work and team building-

Students should learn the importance of good collaboration among the people working in a group to achieve a shared goal. The team members should share the vision to complete the project effectively and efficiently before a deadline. Also, students working in a team should learn to trust and respect each other and every member should have its own duties and responsibilities.

學生須在上學期開始時自行組合成3至4人小組，並在改選期之後定立其研究範疇，研究題目與內容，並提及一書面提案。每組的研究為期6至8星期；各組員須按其計劃進行研究並展示團隊工作和團隊建設元素。研究計劃不能只是一個純粹的學術研究而是就生物化學如何對香港社會發揮影響進行研究，包含或不包含實驗元素。在上學期完結時，各組須就其研究成果作書面及公開的海報報告。

各研究計劃應具備以下元素：

1. 知識為本學習-

本部分將透過指定的工作坊或導修等形式教授學生與生物化學相關的基礎知識及技能，當中包括科學文獻的理解及寫作技巧，生物化學實驗的基本運算和統計學等；

2. 技能為本學習-

本部分將訓練學生有關資訊科技，資料搜集及數據分析等技能；

3. 體驗式學習-

本部分將讓學生透過親身進行各種學習活動諸如調查訪問和實地考察等體驗式學習，加深其對生物化學在社會企業的應用。

4. 團隊合作和團隊建設-

學生應該學習團隊中人合作的重要性，以實現共同目標。 團隊成員應該分享願景，在期限前有效完成項目。 另外，團隊中的學生應該學會互相信任，相互尊重，每個成員都應該有自己的責任和義務。

学生须在上学期开始时自行组合成3至4人小组，并在改选期之后定立其研究范畴，研究题目与内容，并提及一书面提案。每组的研究为期6至8星期；各组员须按其计划进行研究并展示团队工作和团队建设元素。研究计划不能只是一个纯粹的学术研究而是就生物化学如何对香港社会发挥影响进行研究，包含或不包含实验元素。在上学期完结时，各组须就其研究成果作书面及公开的海报报告。

各研究计划应具备以下元素：

1. 知识为本学习-

本部分将透过指定的工作坊或导修等形式教授学生与生物化学相关的基础知识及技能，当中包括科学文献的理解及写作技巧，生物化学实验的基本运算和统计学等；

2. 技能为本学习-

本部分将训练学生有关资讯科技，资料搜集及数据分析等技能；

3. 体验式学习-

本部分将让学生透过亲身进行各种学习活动诸如调查访问和实地考察等体验式学习，加深其对生物化学在社会企业的应用。

4. 团队合作和团队建设-

学生应该学习团队中人合作的重要性，以实现共同目标。团队成员应该分享愿景，在期限前有效完成项目。另外，团队中的学生应该学会互相信任，相互尊重，每个成员都应该有自己的责任和义务。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
By questionnaire and focus group after the completion of the projects.

完成項目後通過問卷調查和焦點小組 。
courses.required_readings:
1. Stuart Johnson & Jon Scott. (2014). Study & Communication Skills for the Biosciences, 2nd ed. Oxford University Press.

2. Stephanie Evergreen. (2017). Presenting Data Effectively: Communicating Your Findings for Maximum Impact. SAGE Publications, Inc.

3. Andrew Blann. (2014). Data Handling and Analysis. OUP Oxford.

4. Nessar Ahmed, Hedley Glencross & Qiuyu Wang. (2016). Biomedical Science Practice, 2nd ed. OUP Oxford.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: Students shall be required to present the results of their research to their peers and staff.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry
courses.learning_outcomes:
After finishing the course, students should be able to
(1) acquire core knowledge in general biochemistry and in-depth knowledge in a particular field of biomedical sciences for research.
(2) acquire life-long learning skills to be an independent researcher.
(3) acquire knowledge to plan research work.
(4) acquire generic skills such as analytical skills, communication skills and writing skills.
(5) acquire skills how to prepare manuscript for publication.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Thesis Research

meetings.instructor: Staff
Staff

courses.description: In this course, a student is required to meet regularly with his/her supervisor who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the student’s academic progress.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry
courses.learning_outcomes: Development of research skills, including field and/or laboratory studies and data analysis as related to the students' thesis research.
courses.course_syllabus:
- Identify a research topic

- Develop a research hypothesis

- Prepare a research proposal

- Develop research methodology and experimental design

- Conduct an original *research* with impact in a specific field or subject

- Analyze experimental results and make appropriate data interpretation

- Prepare a research dissertation/thesis and related manuscripts for publication
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Discussion with students

2. Self-reflection of teacher(s)

3. Feedback from alumni

4. Feedback from Visiting Committee and regular programme reviews
